New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history
Shohei Ohtani hit 47th homer of the season
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a career-high 47th homer in the first inning
Will Smith, Max Muncy, and Tommy Edman hit back-to-back-to-back homers in the first inning
Tommy Edman hit a two-run homer to left field and a two-run shot to right from the left side of the plate in the eighth
Seiya Suzuki hit a solo homer in the third
Cody Bellinger hit a three-run shot in the fifth
Pete Crow-Armstrong's single tied the score 7-7 in the seventh
Gavin Lux lined a clutch, two-out RBI single to center in the seventh
Tommy Edman hit a two-run homer in the eighth
Michael Kopech survived a harrowing ninth, walking the first three batters before getting Paredes to hit a sacrifice fly to right
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers might want to add another giveaway item to the 18 bobblehead dolls and various jerseys, sweatshirts and hats on this year’s promotional calendar: chest protector night, with free catcher’s gear for fans in the right-field pavilion at Dodger Stadium.

Shohei Ohtani’s offensive season is superior to Francisco Lindor’s with a.292 average,.992 on-base-plus-slugging percentage, 47 homers, 30 doubles, seven triples, 104 RBIs, 116 runs, 48 stolen bases in 52 attempts, 74 walks and 146 strikeouts in 143 games

Dodgers avoided a three-game sweep, pushed their National League West lead to five games over Arizona and 5½ over San Diego, and reduced their magic number to clinch the division title to 12 with 16 games to play
Post-Match Reflections: We all definitely know what’s going on. It’s fun to watch. It’s fun to get a chance to see it every night. … It’s pretty impressive what he’s doing individually, but he’s also helping us win games

Indeed, the Dodgers avoided a three-game sweep, pushed their National League West lead to five games over Arizona and 5½ over San Diego, and reduced their magic number to clinch the division title to 12 with 16 games to play

I saw a lot of fight. It’s been a while since I’ve felt the energy, the buzz in the dugout that we had in that first inning. We got off to a really good start, took a couple of punches, gave up a big inning and the lead and battled back
